oracle.spatial.hadoop.rasterapi.core.beans

Class Raster

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.spatial.hadoop.rasterapi.core.beans.Raster

  • public class Raster
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a raster already loaded in HFDS, used to create a catalog that is sent for processing to Hadooop

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Raster() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getCompactRaster()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Raster

        public Raster()

    • Method Detail

      • setRasterLocation

        public void setRasterLocation(java.lang.String RasterLocation)
        Sets the raster location, this is the .ohif path in HDFS
        Parameters:
        RasterLocation - the .ohif path in HDFS of the raster to add in the catalog for processing

      • setBands

        public void setBands(int bands)
        Sets the number of bands in this raster
        Parameters:
        bands - number of bands in this raster stored as a .ohif file in HDFS

      • setBandsOrder

        public void setBandsOrder(java.lang.String bandsOrder)
        Sets the order of how the bands of this raster should appear in mosaic output. It is a comma separated list. For a 3 band image should be "1,2,3", but it could be just "3,1", the number of bands in this value will be the bands appearing in the output.
        Parameters:
        bandsOrder - the String representing the order of appearance for bands in this raster in the output mosaic.

      • setDataType

        public void setDataType(int dataType)
        Sets the data type of this raster.
        Parameters:
        dataType - Data type of this raster, it must be gdal supported data type.

      • getCompactRaster

        public java.lang.String getCompactRaster()
        Gets a String representing this raster, used to set it to Job configuration.
        Returns:
        the raster information in a single String object. String has the following information about the raster: raster*bandsOrder*bands*dataType
